attributes.action: Hold a national referendum on whether the UK should rejoin the EU
attributes.additional_details: Ten years ago, the public voted to leave the EU, but voters were not fully informed of the consequences. Since then, Brexit has contributed to a £20 billion loss in productivity in the UK’s financial sector, with firms relocating to EU cities such as Frankfurt and Paris. It has also increased the cost of living, adding nearly £6 billion to UK food bills in just two years. Despite this, little has been done to address or reverse these impacts.
attributes.background: We call on the government to begin the necessary steps toward rejoining the European Union and to hold a national referendum so the public can decide whether the UK should rejoin.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/747385
